row.Transcription: DIS . MANIBUS . S[ACRUM] / C . CLATIO . RUFO . CO[- - -] / CARISSIMO . SUO [BENE] / MERENTI . D[- - -] / AUREL[IA] / [C]
row.Provenance: Via Ostiensis
row.Translation: Sacred to the shades of the dead. Aurelia [set this up] to Gaius Clatius Rufus, her dearest, well-deserving [husband].
row.Measurements_in_cm.:_width_x_height__x_d: 20.8 x 5.4-11.8 x 2.5. Projected original surface perhaps 30 x 14.

row.Transcription: D(IS) • M(ANIBUS) / AEMILIVS EVTYCHE<S> / FABIO ANICETO/ AMICO BENE • ME / RENTI • FECIT
row.Provenance: Found on Via Ostiensis, near St. Paul's.
row.Translation: For the shades of the dead. Aemilius Eutychus build this for Fabius Anicetus, a well deserving friend.

row.Transcription: Front: [---]YCHE / [---]L / [---]((SI))BI • ET Reverse: IVLIA[---] / FECI((T)) / [---] ((ACIIF))[---]
row.Provenance: Found in Via Ostiensis, near St. Paul's.

row.Transcription: D(IS) • M(ANIBUS) • S(ACRUM) / IVLIAE • C • F • PALLADI / Q(VAE) • V(IXIT) • A(NNIS) • XIII • M(ENSES) • XI • / FILIAE • DVLCISSIMAE / AC • DESIDERANTISSIMAE / FECIT • C(AIVS) • IVLIVS • HAGNVS • PATER
row.Provenance: Found on via Ostiensis, near St. Paul's.
row.Translation: Sacred to the shades of the dead. For Julia Pallas daughter of Gaius, who lived thirteen years and six months, the sweetest and most greatly missed daughter, her father Gaius Julius Hagnus made this.

row.Transcription: D((IS M))ANIB(US) / M(ARCI) COR((N))ELI • FAUSTI / FUFIA • ((P))RISCA / CON((IUX)) [---]
row.Provenance: found on the Via Ostiensis, near St. Paul's.
row.Translation: For the shade of Marcus Cornelius Faustus, Fufia Prisca his wife [made this].

row.Transcription: D[is Manibus] / FES[ - - -] / PLOT[ - - -] / SER . IV [- - -] / PAT . . H[ S E?]
row.Provenance: found on the Via Ostiensis, near St. Paul's.
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead. To Fes(tus?), Plot(ina?) made this, (a slave for 4 years? To a patron?)

row.Transcription: M)AGIAE [- - -] / PIERID(I) / L. TREBIUS . OPT(ATUS) / VXORI . PIISSIM(AE)
row.Provenance: found on the Via Ostiensis, near St. Paul's.
row.Translation: Lucius Trebius Optatus [set this up for] his most dutiful wife, Magia Pieris (or for Magia and the Muse?).

row.Transcription: OSSA / Q • EPIUS • Q • L / BARNAE
row.Provenance: found on the Via Ostiensis, near St. Paul's.
row.Suggested_date: Late 1st century BCE to early 1st century CE.

row.Object_Name: epitaph of Ennia Secunda and Ovia Agile
row.Transcription: ENNIA . >(AIAE) . L(IBERTA) SECVNDA . VIXIT . / ANNIS . X X X X . L . OVIVS . L . L . / APOLLONIVS . FECIT . CONTVBENALI / SVAE . CARISSIMAE . ET . SIBI / OVIA / AGILE / V . A . XXVI
row.Provenance: found on the Via Ostiensis, near St. Paul's. Broken deliberately by workmen!
row.Translation: Ennia Secunda, freedwoman of Gaia, lived for 40 years. Lucius Ovius Apollonius, the freedman of Lucius, made this for his most dearly beloved companion and for himself. Ovia Agile lived 26 years.

row.Transcription: D(IS) • M(ANIBUS) / ((E))VHODIA • HAVE / LICINIAE • EVHODIAE / LIBERTAE • BENEMERENTI / LICINIVS • APHRODISI / VS •(…..)[---]
row.Provenance: Via Ostiensis
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead, Salute Euhodia! Licinius Aphrodisius made this for Licinia Euhodia a well deserving freewoman.

row.Transcription: Θ(άνατος) • ATEIA • ASIA
row.Provenance: From Via Ostiensis, Rome.
row.Translation: The Dead Atia Asia.
row.Suggested_date: Mid 1st century BCE to 1st century CE.

row.Transcription: [---]TARIVS • ) • L • PROTOGENES / [---]INVCIA • Q • L • CHRESTE / [---]Q • CRETARIVS • Q • L • DEVTER / [---][[---]]
row.Provenance: found on the Via Ostiensis, near St. Paul's.

row.Transcription: D(IS) M(ANIBUS)[---] / M • VALE[---] / SOSIM[---] DIAE • V / [---] RIAE •[---] / SVA[---] / B [---]
row.Provenance: found on the Via Ostiensis, near St. Paul's.
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead. Marcus Valerius Sosimus (?)... to Valeria...his (well-deserving wife)

row.Transcription: D • M / VALERIA • L • FILIA • CASTRESIS / VIXIT • ANN • IIII • DIE / XXIII • B • M • FECERVNT / VALERIA • HAVE
row.Provenance: found on the Via Ostiensis, near St. Paul's.
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead. Valeria Lucia the daughter of Castres lived four years, and thirteen days. They made this for her, who was well deserving. Salute Valeria!

row.Transcription: L • OCTAVI • L • L LYSIMACHI • / DORi PVB / ((O))SSA HIC SITA SUNT
row.Provenance: Via Ostiensis
row.Translation: The bones of Lucius Octavius freedman of Lucius and Lysimachus Publicus lie here.

row.Transcription: EMIT • ET HISRO CON • SVO / KAR • ET • LIB • LIBER • SVIS • POST / ERIS • Q • MEORVM • H • M • H • / (..)TERVM [---]
row.Provenance: Via Ostiensis

row.Transcription: D(IS) • M(ANIBUS) / MARQUS • VLPIVS / PRIMITIVS MARCO • VLPIO • SECONDO / ALVMNO • SVO / BENE • MER / ENTI • FECIT / CVI • VIXT • ANIS XIII / DIEBVS X [---]
row.Provenance: found on the Via Ostiensis, near St. Paul's.
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead. Marcus Ulpius the First, made this for his foster son well deserving Marcus Ulpius the Second who lived 13 years and 10 (or more) days.

row.Transcription: NI [I - - - ] /{}C . N [I- - -] /ET . T{E}REBO[ - - -] / PARENT[ES] / LIBERT[- - -] / POS[TERIS - - -] / EORU[M - - -]
row.Provenance: found on the Via Ostiensis, near St. Paul's.
row.Translation: To Ni[?]...Gaius... and Trebonia... parents (made this for) their freedmen and their freedmen's descendants.

row.Transcription: FRATRI . K[ARO] / F[ECIT]
row.Provenance: via Ostiensis
row.Translation: ...made this for a dear brother....
row.Suggested_date: 1st century A.D.? Bodel and Tracy give 1st to 2nd century CE.

row.Transcription: [.]M FECIT . ET / SIBI . ET . AMBA / SIAE NEPOTIL / LAE FIL . SUAE .
row.Publication: Fragment of CIL 06, 36112; Gatti Not. Scav. 1898, p.166.
row.Provenance: CIL: fragmentum...repertum in vinea Tancioni in collibus Monteverde extra portam Portuensam / Olcott: from via Ostiensis
row.Translation: ...made this both for him-/herself and for Ambasia Nepotilla, his / her daughter.

row.Transcription: AVR • EVTYCHVS • / SILANIAE • EVTERPE / (..)CONIVGE • SVAE • / (.....)nPARAVIT / (.....)((VIX))IT • ANN
row.Provenance: from Via Ostiensis
row.Translation: Aurelius Eutchus prepared this for his wife Silania Euterpe who lived... years...

row.Transcription: D • M / CLAUDIA DATA / PATRONIS • BENE / MERENTIBUS • FECIT
row.Provenance: from Via Ostiensis
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead. Claudia Data made this for her well deserving patrons.

row.Object_Name: Epitaph of Elate V[---] and Cyrus(?)
row.Transcription: ELATE • V[---] / CYRVS • ET • [---] / CONSERV •[---] / BENE • MER[---]
row.Provenance: from Via Ostiensis

row.Transcription: D • M / IVLIA BOLVPTAS BI / XIT ANNIS • XXIII • MEN / SIBVS • III • DIEBVS • XXIIII / VARIA RODOPE AL • V • M / NAE BENEMERENTI FECIT
row.Provenance: From Via Ostiensis, near S. Paolo fuori le Mura.
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead. Julia Boluptas, lived 23 years, three months, and 24 days. Varia Rodope made this for her who was dear and well deserving.

row.Transcription: P • MAECIVS / PAMPHILVS / IVLIA • P • L • ATHENAIS
row.Provenance: From Via Ostiensis
row.Translation: Publius Maecius Pamphilus and Julia Athena the freedwoman of Publius.

row.Medium: Course yellow stone with veins of blue.
row.Transcription: [---]ETVENTES[---] / [---]ATVTEGOPA[---] / [---]tOTIVSORB[---] / [---]oRIs[---]
row.Provenance: From Via Ostiensis, Rome.

row.Transcription: Θ • Κ • / Προσδοκίμῳ / Ταρσῇ θανόντι / ἔτων δεκαοκώ / ὑιῶ χρηστοτάτω / τύμβον ὁ Προσδόκισμος
row.Provenance: From Via Ostiense, Roma.
row.Translation: To Shades of the Dead, Prosdocimus made this tomb for Prosdocimus of Tarsis, the best son who died at 18 years of age.

row.Object_Name: Greek verse tombstone of a man
row.Transcription: ΔΕ ΒΙΟC ΜΟΙ . CΥ[Ν - - -] /ΕΤΕΡΟΙC ΕΝΘΑ ΛΙ[- - -] /ΛΩΝ . ΘΑΠΤΕ ΤΥ[- - -] /ΓΥΝΗ ΜΕ ΕΤΟC ΤΕ[- - -] / ΚΟCΤΟΝ ΑΓΟΝΤΑ .
row.Provenance: From Via Ostiensis, Rome
row.Translation: ...and life to me, (with) the others there, (a stone)... my wife (Tyche?) buried me here when I was in my (fiftieth?) year.

row.Transcription: CLAVDIA • ) • LIB • / TYRANNIS • / VIX • AN • XVII
row.Provenance: from a columbarium "fuori Porta Salaria" now destroyed
row.Translation: Claudia the freedwoman of Claudia lived 17.

row.Transcription: DIS • MANIBUS / L • GAVI • AMARANTI / CLAUDIA • VXOR / VIRO • S • B • M • F
row.Provenance: from a columbarium on the Via Salaria, outside the Porta Salaria.
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Underworld. Claudia made this for Lucius Gavius Amarantius, as a wife for her well deserving husband.

row.Transcription: M • IVLIVS / HEDVLVS
row.Provenance: From a columbarium now destroyed "fuori Porta Salaria"
row.Translation: Marcus Julius Hedulus.

row.Transcription: VRGVLANIA / PSEPHIS / VIX • AN • XXII
row.Provenance: from Via Salaria / effossi 1877 in vinea Aquariorum.
row.Translation: Urgulania Psephis lived 22 years.

row.Transcription: P • POMPONIO / P • L • PHILOSITO / NOMENCLAT
row.Provenance: from Via Salaria / from "fuori Porta Salaria"
row.Translation: To Publius Pomponius, the freedman of Publius and nomenclator (name-reminder).

row.Transcription: C • PLOTIVS • C • L • / ANTIOCHVS / DIONISIA
row.Provenance: From Via Salaria
row.Translation: Gaius Plotius Antiochus Dionisia freedman of Gaius.

row.Transcription: SVETONIA CC • ET • ) • L • PELAGIA
row.Provenance: from a columbarium, now destroyed, on the Via Salaria, near gate. / "Fuori Porta Salaria"
row.Translation: Suetonia Pelagia, the freedwoman of two men called Gaius and a woman.

row.Transcription: TREBONI[A] / EVCHE
row.Provenance: from a columbarium on the Via Salaria
row.Translation: Trebonia Euche?

row.Transcription: D . IVNIVS / TIPHVS
row.Provenance: Olcott: "Inscription has been long known a statement that it was found on Via Salaria may be tradition. Bought off dealer Pasinati Jan 30, 1897"; CIL: "Apud Vescovalium Fea Am. Anno 1878 apud antiquarium Pasinati" etc.
row.Translation: Decimus Iunius Tiphus

row.Transcription: M. VALERIVS / DAMOPHILVS
row.Provenance: from Via Salaria
row.Translation: Marcus Valerius Damophilus

row.Transcription: AV. POMPEI. AV . L . HILARI/ POMPEIA . EGLOGE . CN. POMPEI . CN . L . HILARIO
row.Provenance: From Via Salaria
row.Translation: Aulus Pompeia Hilari freedman of Aulus, Pomeia Egloge Gnaeus Pompeius Hilarius freedman of Gnaeus.

row.Transcription: COMPARAV<<I>>IS [---] / GAIANA [---] / CONIVGI • [---]
row.Provenance: from Via Salaria

row.Transcription: D • M / CATILLIAE / PROTOCTES / L • CATILLIVS / FELIX / LIBERTAE / B • M • FECIT / LOCVS • DONATVS / A • LVCIA FOTINE
row.Provenance: Olcott: Bought from Pasinati, Jan 30, 1897; CIL: prope Romam reperta, extabat apud Pasinatium antiquarium.
row.Translation: To the Shades Catillia Protocte, Lucius Catillius Felix made this for his well deserving freedwoman. The space was given by Lucia Fotine.

row.Transcription: [---] M / [---]NAIAE • ETM • CIO / [---]VIX • ANN • XII [---] / D • XXVII / [---]
row.Provenance: from Via Salaria

row.Transcription: ORPHEVS / AGITATOR
row.Provenance: from Via Salaria / "fuori Porta Salaria"
row.Translation: Orpheus the charioteer.

row.Transcription: D . M / FIDO . VIXIT / ANN(IS). IIII . ME(NSIBVS) . VI . DIEBVS) . XVI / FIDUS PATER / FECIT
row.Publication: CIL 6.35253; Gatti apud Fiorellium Not. Scav. 1888 p.282 n.893
row.Provenance: From Olcott: "From Via Ostiensis"; CIL: reperta inter vias Salariam et Pincianam.
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead. Fidus, a father, made this for Fidus, who lived 4 years, 6 months, 16 days.

row.Transcription: D . M . S . / M. FVNDANIVS . SE/ CVNDVS . VIX . AN . XXXX / FECIT . ISTIMENIA . HELPIS / CONIVGI . SVO . B. M.
row.Provenance: From a columbarium on the Via Ostiensis, near S. Paolo fuori le Mura.
row.Translation: Sacred to the Shades of the Dead; Marcus Fundanius Secundus lived 40 years. Istimenia Helpis made this for her well-deserving husband.

row.Object_Name: columbarium (?) to the Juno of Trolia Musa (?)
row.Transcription: IVNONI / TROLIAES / MUSAES
row.Provenance: n.b. Olcott AJA 10 (1906), 156 n.1 doubts the authenticity of this inscription.
row.Translation: To the Juno of Trolia Musa.

row.Transcription: D(is) M(anibus) / HERTORIAE . IVSTE . / . C(aius) . IVLIVS . LIBERALIS / . MIL(es) . COH(ortis) . XI . VRB(anae) . 7 . LA / TINI . / CON(iugi) . SAN(ctissimae) . BEN(e) . M(erenti) . / . Q(uae) . M(ecum) . BEN(e) . V(ixit) . ANN(is) . X . / ME(n)S(ibus) . VI . DIEB(us) . VIII .
row.Provenance: Presumably from Rome, since 11th urban cohort.
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead of Hertoria Iusta. Gaius Julius Liberalis, soldier of the 11th urban cohort, a centurion (Latini?), to his well-deserving and most pious wife, who lived with me for 10 years, 6 months, 8 day.

row.Object_Name: epitaph of Cornelia Onesime and Sutorius Primus
row.Transcription: D . M / SEX . CORNELIVS . FIRMVS / FECIT . CORNELIAE . ONESIM[A]E / LIBERTAE . ET COIVGI . B . M . ET / SIBI . ET . C . SVTORIO . PRIMO . / LIBERTIS . LIBERTABVSQVE PO /STERISQVE . EORVM
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead. Sextus Cornelius Firmus made this for Cornelia Onesima, his freedwoman and well-deserving wife, and for himself, and for Gaius Sutorius Primo, for his freedmen and freedwomen and their descendants.

row.Transcription: D • M / TITACIAE • / PRISCILLAE / CONIVGI • CAS / TISSIMAE • AC / SANCTISSIMAE / BENEMERENTI / FECIT • TITACIVS / VALENS • PATRO / NVS • ET • CONTV / BERNALIS
row.Provenance: found in 1903 excavating for a villino in Via Boncompagni opp. the (former) Pensione Giannelli, Rome. Acquired in 1903.
row.Translation: To the Shades of Dead. Titacius Valens the patron and companion made this for Titacia Priscilla, his most chaste, most sacred and well-deserving wife.

row.Transcription: D • M • S • / M • AVG • IANVARIO / EQVITI COH • VIIII • PR • / • 7 • FAVENTINI / QVI • VIX • ANN • XX / MILIT • ANN • III • M • XI / AVG • VERANVS • 7 • / COH • II • PR • SECVN / DVS • HERES • b • M • / POSVIT
row.Provenance: in vinea Aquaria via Latina paene e regione portae.
row.Translation: Sacred to the Shades of the Dead. Augustus Veranus centurian of the second praetorian cohort heir of the well deserving Marcus Augustus Januarius horseman, centurion of the 9th praetorian cohort Faventinius, who lived 20 years and performed three years and nine months of military service.

row.Transcription: D • M • / SAMIARIAE / CHRYSOGONE / VXORI KARISSIM / CORNELIVS • PHILO / MARITVS • ET • CHRYSOGO / NVS • FILIVS itEM APHRO / DITE ALUMNAE
row.Publication: AE (1988): 1142; Aubert, Lenz, Roth, and Sheridan, ZPE 73 (1988): 95, no. 6, Taf. VI
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead of Samiaria Chrysogone. Cornelius Philo, her husband, and Chrysogonus, her son, made this for a very dear wife. Also for Aphrodite the foster-child.

row.Transcription: D . M . /FVNDILIAE . CRESCEN /TINAE . FILIAE . DVL /CISSIMAE . QVAE VI /XIT . ANNIS . V . DIEBVS /XXVIII . IVLIVS . ELPIDEFORVS . /[PA]TER . ET . ANTHIA . VICTORIA . MA/ [TER PA]RENTES . FECERVNT / hedera
row.Provenance: Found many years ago in the ruins of an ancient tomb in a field near S. Agnese, Via Nomentana. Acquired in 1901. First copied on December 6, 1873 by Pellegrini, in a manuscript report presented to the government authorities.
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead of Fundilia Crescentina. Iulius Elpideforus, a father, and Anthia Victoria, the mother, as parents made this for a most sweet daughter, who lived 5 years, 28 days.

row.Transcription: APOLLINARI CALVISI . ET /MAIAE . L(ibertus). VIXIT ANN(os) XVIII / P(ublius). CALVISIVS . P(ubli) . ET G(aiae). L(ibertus). [HY]MEN / MAIA . G(aiae) . L(iberta) . [. . . . .] [FE]CERVNT ET / SIBI . ET SVIS / A(ulus) . POPILLIVS . [A(uli)] L(ibertus) . CHRESTIO / A . POPILLIVS . A(uli) . L(ibertus) . [....]ESI[M]VS . / POPILLIA . [A] . L(iberta) . LA[...]E
row.Provenance: apud Ficoronium?
row.Translation: To Apollinaris, freedman of Calvisius and Maia. He lived 18 years. Publius Calvisius Hymen, freedman of Publius and a woman and Maia, freedwoman of a woman, made this for both themselves and their own. Aulus Popillius Chrestio, freedman of Aulus; Aulus Popillius [?], son of Aulus; Popillia [Lache?] freedwoman of Aulus.

row.Transcription: D • M / IVIO DIODORO / FECIT • IVLIASISIP / PAE • BENEMEREN / TI MARiTO SVO / QVINQVN VIXI • ANIS • / • X • MES • VI • DIB • VIII
row.Provenance: apud antiquarium quendam
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead:

row.Transcription: D • M • / SILICIANVS / QVI • VIXIT • / ANNIS • LXVIII / MENSES • III • D • XI / FECIT • HILARITAS / COIVGI • SVO BENE • MEREN / TI
row.Publication: AE (1988): 1144; Aubert, Lenz, Roth, and Sheridan, ZPE 73 (1988): 96, no. 8, Taf. VII
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead: Silicianus who lived 68 years, 3 months, 11 days. Hilaritas made this for her well deserving husband.

row.Transcription: D. M /L . SENTIUS . HERMA . /CORNELIAE FELICISSIMAE . /COIVGI BENE MERENTI /FECIT . QV[A]E VIXIT . /ANNIS . XXII . /MENSIBUS . VIII . /DIEBUS . XVIIII .
row.Publication: CIL 6.36326; Gatti, Notizie degli Scavi 1900, p.255; Bull. Comun. 1900 p.220.
row.Provenance: "reperta in fundamentis domus via della Cordonata".
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead. Lucius Sentius Herma made this for his well-deserving, most fortunate wife, Cornelia, who lived 22 years, 8 months and 19 days.

row.Transcription: D .M . / CAECILIAE . IANVARIAE / VIX . AN . VIII / M . X . FECI[T?] . M ./ CAECILIVS . /MESSALA . ET ./ [GAR]G[ILIA] . IANV / [A]RIA . ALVMN / AE SV[A]E
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead of Caecilia Ianuaria. She lived 8 years, 10 months. (I?) Marcus Caecilius Messala and Gargilia (?) Ianuaria made this for their foster-child.

row.Transcription: ἐνθά[δε κεῖτε] / Εὔκα[πος νή]/ πιος [ὅσιος] / φιλόν[ομος] / ἐν εἰρ[ήνη κοίμησίς σου.]
row.Translation: Here lies young Eukapos, holy, lover of the law, may your sleep be in peace.

row.Transcription: D . M / IV.LI.O. E. / RO.TI. VIX / AN.NIS.VI / T. F. GL. ME / L.LVS . MIL / CL. PR . MIS / B . M . FECIT
row.Provenance: unknown
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead. To Julius Eros. He lived 6 years. Titus Flavius Gemellus, soldier of the praetorian fleet at Misenum made this for a well-deserving fellow.

row.Object_Name: epitaph of Fortunata and Valeria Moschis
row.Transcription: Column 1 D . M / FORTUNATAE / VIXIT /ANNIS . XXII / MENS(IBVS) . XI / DIE(BVS) . XIII / ATTICUS / SVAE / [CON]SERVAE. B.M. FECIT Column 2 D . M / VALERIA / MOSCHIS VIX / ANNIS . LXXX / VALERIA / EUTICHIA / PATRONAE / B . M . F
row.Provenance: apud antiquarium in via Sixtina.
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead of Fortunata. She lived 22 years, 11 months, 13 days. Atticus made this for his well-deserving fellow-slave. To the Shades of the Dead. Valeria Moschis lived 80 years. Valeria Eutichia made this for her well-deserving patroness.

row.Transcription: Front: D . M / ABASCANTO / FILIO . FECIT / ABASCANTVS / PATER . B. M. Reverse:D . M. / SAVINVS / ET . SECVNDIL .LA / ET. FRATRHES / FILIO. Q. VI.X A.N.XIII / B . M F EC
row.Provenance: Rossi: titulus e sepulcreto quodam effosso anno 1857 in praedio vulgo Tor Marancia via Ardeatina. Dressel: apud antiquarium Pennelli in platea Campo de' Fiori.
row.Translation: To the Shades of the Dead. Abascantus, a father, made this for his well-deserving son, Abanscantus. To the Shades of the Dead. Savinus and Secundilla and their brothers (?), for a well-deserving son who lived 13 years.

row.Transcription: TV . QVAE O . SANC . TIS /SI . MA . CON . IVNX . FELIX . /MORTE . TVA . NEQVE . IN . / HVNC . SERVATA . DOLORE[M] / NECRUDELIS FILI FAC. / TA . VI . DERES. / ET . VOS . FELI . CES . DUL . CIS . SI . / MAE . FILI . AE . RE . LIC . TO FRA . / TRE . IN . DIGNO . NO . MI . NE . / VES . TRO .
row.Provenance: unknown
row.Translation: O you, my most pious and happy wife, who by your death, neither in this grief looked after, nor should you see the deeds of a cruel son. And you, my happy, sweetest daughters, with your brother lost, in your worthy name.

row.Object_Name: reworked stone, epitaph of L. Publicius Perennius
row.Transcription: [D M ] / L. PVBLICIVS / EPITYNCHANVS / PERENNIO / FILIO . DVLC / ISSIMO . VIX / AN. VIII . ET . SVIS / FEC

D M / L. GRATI.I . L . F . CLAV /VERINI. CEMENE /LI. MIL. FRVM. LEG . / II . AVG . VIX . ANN . / XXXI . MILITAVIT . / AN . XII . FECIT . HE /RES . Q . AEMILIVS /MARINUS . SIN /GULAR . /LEG . HI / V S D
row.Publication: CIL 06, 03339; Bull. dell'inst. 1849 p.106; syllog. Orellianae vol. III n.6818.; ILS 2364
row.Provenance: reperta in vinea Aquariorum extra portam Latinam, nunc in aedibus eorundem.

row.Transcription: D M / POM.PEIAE . GN . FIL . AV / GVRI . NAE . MATRI . PIEN / TISSIMAE . AE. LI. I . PVBLI. / FILI. NIGRINVS . ET AVGV. /RINA. FECERVNT . LIBER /TIS . LIBERTABVSQ. /POSTERIS /Q. EORVM.

. D ./ FAVSTINA . M . / COIVGISVO DVLCISSIMO / PRIMITIBO BE NEM E RENTI / XL / QVMQVOVIXIT . ANNIS . XII . MES . / VIII . DIEBVS . VII . ET . DISCENTES . / FECERVNT . FELIX . ET . MAXIMI / NVS . MAGISTRO . BENE . MERENTI / QVIF ANO
D • M / C • SILI • MAXIm / MIL • CLAS • P • MIsi / aN • XXXX • MIL XIX • / IVLI • PRIS / C •

row.Transcription: EGNA[T .]VLEIA[E] / M. L. HILARAE / SIBEI . ET. LEIBE[RT] / IN FR P.XIIX / IN. AGR. P.XIIX
row.Provenance: found in vinea Aquariorum, but no agreement about when or exactly where.
row.Translation: To Egnatuleia Hilara, freedwoman of Marcus; [Marcus Egnatuleius set this up?] for himself and his freed slaves. [The funerary plot is] 18 feet wide and 18 feet deep.
row.Suggested_date: Mid 1st century BCE to early 1st century CE.

row.Transcription: [. .]AGRIUS SAGIT(TA) FAL(ERNA TRIBU) . VENID(IVS) VIT(VULVS) /[V]ALERIVS . ASIAT(ICUS) . II . M SILANUS / K(ALENDIIS) . MAR(TIIS) LOC(O) . VA[LE]R(i?) VETUS . ANTIS[. . .] /K(ALENDIIS) IUL(IIS). D . LAELIUS BAL[BVS] / K(ALENDIIS). OCT(OBRIBUS) C TERENTIUS [T]ULLIUS [GEMINVS] / Q . COELIUS GALLUS A . BADIUS SEXT(VS) IV V[IRI] / M. PLINIUS GALL(VS) . M . OPPIUS . VAL(ERIVS) AED(ILES) / VIPSTAN(IVS) POPL(ICOLA) . MESS(ALA) VIPS [TANIVS] / II MAGISTRA[T(IBVS) EX - - -] / AUG[U - - - ]
row.Provenance: Found in the house of Signor Orazio Pasquale in Curti near Capua (1904), said to have been originally found at Teano, ancient Teanum Sidicinum.
row.Translation: ...agrius Sagitt(a), Marcus Venid(ius) Vitul(us)... (V)alerius Asiaticus (twice consul), Marcus Silanus ... on the first of March, in the Valerian place, Vetus... Antis(tius?)... on the first of July, Decimus Laelius Bal(bus?)... on the first of October, Gaius Terentius Tullius Geminus, Quintus Coelius Gallus, Aulus Badius Sextus were quattuorviri, Marcus Plinius Gallus, Marcus Oppius Valerius were aediles... Vipstanius Poplicola Messala... Vipstanius [with the two functionaries appointed by Augustus?]

row.Publication: Egbert, Supplementary Papers of the American School of Classical Studies in Rome 2 (1908), 273.
row.Provenance: from Schermerhorn
